name: Hotel Los Agustinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is right in the centre of Haro and has its own parking (E15/Day). However, you can walk to the Muga Winery and many others. It is a great location if you to do all the winery stuff. The central Atrium of the Hotel is outstanding, and the rooms and well appointed. The WiFi is good however, they need many repeaters to cope with the solid stone walls. We would certainly return here again. Go directly to the Hotel Website to see what deals they are doing.
reviews.title: Great Location and Historic Hotel
Nice building...
reviews.text: Rooms are allright and very clean, but I expect a bit more warmness from the host when traveling. No one was displeasent, but you kind of feel like you are at the doctors offfice front desk when you check-in.
Maybe a free continental breakfast could help make the stay a bit more warmer.... For the price... Next time, i will try an other hote
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay! Great Food and Great Wine!

reviews.text: Haro is a nice little town, but after seing some of the smaller villages around, we would have staid in St-vicent....
reviews.title: October in La Rioja

reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels in Spain and also in Rioja. This hotel is amazing. The staff were great the rooms were clean and it is perfectly located to travel around and visit different bodegas. I stayed in room 415 which I highly recommend. It is a junior suite so a little more expensive but the room is huge. Alas, no beach view to speak of but other than that great great great,. The restaurant served up some great Riojan meals which many of you will find second to none.
reviews.title: A magnificent building, a well run hotel with friendly courteous staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left San Sebastian on a wine tour they dropped us off at haro and recommended this hotel ,wow .how special to stay in something with this much history. The restaurant was lovely , we had a lovely overnight stay in a comfy bed .we wished we could have stayed longer . This is a great place to stay if you are wanting to tour the Rioja wine region ( they organize tours if you want ) . As I said we left San Sebastian on a tour with the Sansebastianfood.com , great day . It worked out great as we were making our way to Madrid , haro is a good stopover . we would totally recommend this beautiful history filled hotel
reviews.title: So much history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely hotel. Haro itself is a bit scruffy, but the hotel is brilliantly placed for touring the Riojan wineries. The restaurant is excellent, with a lovely atmosphere in the centre of the old convent, with fantastic food and a great wine list at good prices. The breakfast was very good, particularly the cakes and patisserie which was local. Staff really friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent food and a good base for Riojan wineries

reviews.text: I have wanted to visit the Rioja region for many years. After some research on where to stay, we chose the hotel Los Agustinos in the centre of Haro.
reviews.title: A Base in Rioja

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is housed in a very spectacular building which has quite a history of its own prior to its present usage. On arrival the central covered courtyard cannot fail to impress. It is absolutely magnificent. Our rooms(there were 4 of us) were excellent, spacious, and quiet. The restaurant was good although the service was a little slow. However as Spain were playing Italy for the crown of European football during our meal perhaps they can be forgiven.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Historic Building

reviews.text: Haro has a wonderful selection of Rioja Bodega's just on the edge of the town. we had made prior arrangements to visit two of them(La Rioja Alta and Muga) where we had excellent visits and copious sampling. What an experience and what a lovely area.
reviews.title: Small hotel, great location, great service

reviews.text: Good place for visiting the wine region. Rooms ok especially as they have a second door separating the entrée from the bedroom. Bathroom poor - this must be the only hotel which has no Kleenex even if you ask for it! Bed ok but terrible foam pillow. Very good breakfast with eggs of all kinds but nobody says "good morning". Staff at reception not friendlier. Neither at the bar. Make sure you do not take an inside room - one of the nights there was a large wedding. Thanks to the two doors on this outside room, we were not disturbed but friends who had an inside room (there are very few) did not sleep until party broke up. One evening we had dinner at the hotel - it was ok and not expensive.
reviews.title: Sorry no kleenex

reviews.text: Altogether a rather pleasant place.
reviews.title: Tired Elegance

reviews.text: This hotel is over rated and in need of a face lift. Our high end travel agency booked us into a large exterior room, but when we found it smelling of cigarette smoke, we had to accept a much smaller substitute on the interior courtyard without a window to the outside fresh air. We didn't mind the size and were glad to have the air conditioner, but we did not get what we paid for.
reviews.title: Central for wine region.

reviews.text: The room was clean and the bed and pillows comfortable, but the furniture, carpet, and bathroom vanity all needed updating. We did not have hot water the first morning which the management blamed on a ciity-wide problem. One afternoon we sat in the large interior courtyard which dates from its days as a convent in the 14th century. We opened a bottle of lovely wine from the surrounding Rioja area, then went to the bar to request some cheeses and bread. We discovered that there was no food service, not even in the bar (depressing by itself), before 8:30pm. This four star hotel refused to serve anything other than potato chips before its restaurant opened for dinner.
reviews.title: Beautiful historic property

reviews.text: Finally, this ancient courtyard which could be an impressive interior space, is instead ruined by tacky lighting, outdated furniture, and other pieces of odd decor that detract from the elegant arches and soaring glass ceiling.They would not have stood for this in Madrid.
reviews.title: Huge rooms
Nice hotel. Don't come on Sunday
reviews.text: We spent one night March 18, 2913 at the hotel, while sneaking in a day and half in Rioja on a 12 day trip through Spain. It it a lovely place. The rooms are ok. Could use a little updating. Although virtually no one spoke any English at all, the staff was mostly pleasant and helpful. However, the bartender was extremely rude and unhelpful. Wifi is free and worked well. They have an arrangement with a gym close by, but the gym doesn't open until 9:30.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is clearly off season for this area, but extremely strange that no restaurant (other than sandwiches at the bar with the rude bartender) is open at the hotel on Sunday. I can't remember being in any quality hotel anywhere in the world where there was no restaurant open.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: We recommend to stay at this hotel. Its a nice experience. The rooms are ok.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel
Great find
reviews.text: Try the restaurant, the food is VERY good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative thing is of there is a wedding the day you stay at the hotel; this may be quite noisy!
reviews.title: Very Nice; great food!

description: THE HOTEL LOS AGUSTINOS, former convent and first-listed building, which has a magnificent cloister, covered with a glass dome and numerous air-conditioned rooms available at the hotel, make this beautiful building ideal place for all kinds of events, meetings, conferences, business lunches, etc. with up to 350 guests.
